params.name: commentId
params.doc: Comment Id

params.name: appId
params.doc: App Id

params.name: commentSort.order
params.doc: Sorting

params.name: commentSort.keepMarkedInOriginalOrder
params.doc:
If set to `true`, marked comments are included in the comments list but maintain their original order rather
 than being moved to the top.
 Defaults to `false`, which means marked comments, will be prioritized and listed first.

params.name: replySort.order
params.doc: Sorting

params.name: replySort.keepMarkedInOriginalOrder
params.doc:
If set to `true`, marked replies are included in the comments list but maintain their original order rather
 than being moved to the top.
 Defaults to `false`, which means marked replies, will be prioritized and listed first.

docs.summary:
Return thread of a comment or reply

If comment thread requested, the API will return a single comment along with cursors that can be utilized with the
ListCommentsByResource API to load previous and subsequent comment pages.

In case reply thread requested, the API will return the root parent comment, the reply itself, and cursors that
can be utilized with the ListCommentsByResource API to load previous and subsequent pages of comments or replies.

params.name: cursorPaging.repliesLimit
params.doc: Only taken into account if listing root comments

docs.summary:
Lists published comments and replies

API designed to load comments and replies. It return only published comments and replies.
Hidden or Deleted comment or reply are not returned unless they have more than one published reply.

examples.title: List Comments
body:
curl --get https://wixapis.com/comments/v1/comments/list-by-resource  \
    -H 'Content-Type: application/json;charset=UTF-8' \
    -H 'Authorization: <AUTH>' \
    -d appId=148c2287-c669-d849-d153-463c7486a694 \
    -d contextId=6f46dbf6-1a48-4870-86b2-f807d8f31b3e \
    -d resourceId=fef60f63-1c88-40e1-bc31-4ac65aa56b03 \
    -d commentSort.order=NEWEST_FIRST \
    -d replySort.order=OLDEST_FIRST \
    -d replySort.keepMarkedInOriginalOrder=true \
    -d cursorPaging.limit=2 \
    -d cursorPaging.repliesLimit=1

extra.description: Fetches list of comments where comments are sorted by oldest first and marked comments are moved to top of the list. Replies are sorted newest first. Initial page will contain 2 comments and 1 reply for each comment that has replies

params.name: revision

params.name: draftContentAction
params.doc: Action to do regarding draft content

docs.summary:
Moderates the draft content of a comment.

- `APPROVE`: Moves `draftContent` to `content` and updates the comment `status` to `PUBLISHED`.
- `REJECT`: Clears `draftContent` if comment `status` is `PUBLISHED` or, if comment `status` is `PENDING` it will keep `draftContent` the same and change `status` to `HIDDEN`.

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs. An unordered map of dynamically typed values.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

docs.summary:
`Struct` represents a structured data value, consisting of fields
 which map to dynamically typed values. In some languages, `Struct`
 might be supported by a native representation. For example, in
 scripting languages like JS a struct is represented as an
 object. The details of that representation are described together
 with the proto support for the language.

 The JSON representation for `Struct` is JSON object.

members.name: fields
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs. An unordered map of dynamically typed values.

docs.summary:
`ListValue` is a wrapper around a repeated field of values.

 The JSON representation for `ListValue` is JSON array.

members.name: values
members.doc: Repeated field of dynamically typed values.

members.name: background
members.doc: The text's background color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: foreground
members.doc: The text's foreground color as a hexadecimal value.

members.name: lineHeight
members.doc: A CSS `line-height` value for the text as a unitless ratio.

members.name: nofollow
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers not to follow the link.

members.name: sponsored
members.doc: Indicates to search engine crawlers that the link is a paid placement such as sponsored content or an advertisement.

members.name: ugc
members.doc: Indicates that this link is user-generated content and isn't necessarily trusted or endorsed by the pageâ€™s author. For example, a link in a fourm post.

members.name: noreferrer
members.doc: Indicates that this link protect referral information from being passed to the target website.

members.name: target
members.doc:
The HTML `target` attribute value for the link. This property defines where the linked document opens as follows:
`SELF` - Default. Opens the linked document in the same frame as the link.
`BLANK` - Opens the linked document in a new browser tab or window.
`PARENT` - Opens the linked document in the link's parent frame.
`TOP` - Opens the linked document in the full body of the link's browser tab or window.

members.name: rel
members.doc: The HTML `rel` attribute value for the link. This object specifies the relationship between the current document and the linked document.

members.name: customData
members.doc: A serialized object used for a custom or external link panel.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the linked document.

members.name: anchor
members.doc: The target node's ID. Used for linking to another node in this object.

members.name: enabled
members.doc: Sets whether the spoiler cover is enabled for this node.

members.name: description
members.doc: The description displayed on top of the spoiler cover.

members.name: buttonText
members.doc: The text for the button used to remove the spoiler cover.

members.name: size
members.doc:
One of the following predefined width options:
`CONTENT`: The width of the container matches the content width.
`SMALL`: Small width.
`ORIGINAL`: The width of the container matches the original asset width.
`FULL_WIDTH`: Full width.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom width value in pixels.

members.name: custom
members.doc: A custom height value in pixels.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: alignment
members.doc: The node's alignment within its container.

members.name: spoiler
members.doc: Spoiler cover settings for the node.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the node when it's displayed.

members.name: textWrap
members.doc: Sets whether text should wrap around this node when it's displayed. If `textWrap` is `false`, the node takes up the width of its container.

members.name: private
members.doc: Indicates whether the file's source is private.

members.name: url
members.doc: The absolute URL for the file's source.

members.name: id
members.doc: An ID that's resolved to a URL by a resolver function.

members.name: src
members.doc: The source for the media's data.

members.name: duration
members.doc: Media duration in seconds. Only relevant for audio and video files.

members.name: autoPlay
members.doc: Sets whether the media will automatically start playing.

members.name: playInLoop
members.doc: Sets whether media's will be looped.

members.name: showControls
members.doc: Sets whether media's controls will be shown.

members.name: width
members.doc: The width of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: height
members.doc: The height of the resource specified in the `url` property in pixels.

members.name: url
members.doc: The source URL for the resource.

members.name: html
members.doc: HTML for embedding a video player. The HTML should have no padding or margins.

members.name: authorName
members.doc: The name of the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: authorUrl
members.doc: The URL for the author or owner of the resource.

members.name: providerName
members.doc: The name of the resource provider.

members.name: providerUrl
members.doc: The URL for the resource provider.

members.name: thumbnailUrl
members.doc: The URL for a thumbnail image for the resource. If this property is defined, `thumbnailWidth` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailWidth
members.doc: The width of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailHeight` must also be defined.

members.name: thumbnailHeight
members.doc: The height of the resource's thumbnail image. If this property is defined, `thumbnailUrl` and `thumbnailWidth`must also be defined.

members.name: videoUrl

members.name: version
members.doc: The oEmbed version number.  This value must be `1.0`.

members.name: slug
members.doc: The version of the user's name that appears after the `@` character in the mention.

members.name: textStyle

members.name: text

members.name: background

members.name: viewMode
members.doc:
PDF view mode. One of the following:  
 `NONE` : The PDF isn't displayed.  
 `FULL` : A full page view of the PDF is displayed.

members.name: resolutions
members.doc: Available resolutions for the video, starting with the optimal resolution.

members.doc: Video format for example, mp4, hls.

members.name: private
members.doc:
When true, this is a protected asset, and calling the URL will return a 403 error.
 In order to access private assets, make a request to:
 `GenerateFileDownloadUrl` with the WixMedia id and specify the asset_key in the request

members.name: assetKey
members.doc:
Key to identify the video resolution's relationship to the original media in WixMedia.
 Can be used to request a download for the specific video resolution.
 For example: 480p.mp4, 720p.mp4, 1080p.mp4, trailer-720p.mp4, clip-720p.mp4

members.name: private
members.doc:
When true, this is a protected asset, and calling the URL will return a 403 error.
 In order to access private assets, make a request to:
 `GenerateFileDownloadUrl` with the WixMedia id and specify the asset_key in the request

members.name: assetKey
members.doc:
Key to identify the object relationship to the original media in WixMedia.
 Can be used to request a download for the specific asset.
 For example: 128-30kbs.mp3, 320kbs.mp3, 128kbs.mp3

docs.summary: Comment content

*
Comment definition

members.name: revision
members.doc: Represents the current state of an item. Each time the item is modified, its `revision` changes. for an update operation to succeed, you MUST pass the latest revision

members.name: createdDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Comment was created

members.name: updatedDate
members.doc: Represents the time this Comment was last updated

members.name: contextType
members.doc: Vertical context type. A single application can have multiple contexts, and context_type can be used to distinguish in what context comments are being used. Reserved for internal use.

members.name: replyCount
members.doc: How many published replies comment has

messages.name: reactionCodeCountMapEntry
messages.displayName: reaction Code Count Map Entry Object

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type integer

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: cursor
members.doc:
Pointer to the next or previous page in the list of results.

You can get the relevant cursor token
from the `pagingMetadata` object in the previous call's response.
Not relevant for the first request.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: hasNext
members.doc:
Indicates if there are more results after the current page.
 If `true`, another page of results can be retrieved.
 If `false`, this is the last page.

members.name: next
members.doc: Cursor pointing to next page in the list of results.

members.name: prev
members.doc: Cursor pointing to previous page in the list of results.

members.name: filter
sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.name: cursorPaging
members.doc: Cursor token pointing to a page of results. Not used in the first request. Following requests use the cursor token and not `filter` or `sort`.

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to retrieve

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to delete

members.name: cascade
members.doc:
Indicates if child comments must be deleted as well.
 Will be deprecated and be replaced by BulkCommentDelete

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to mark

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to mark

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to modify

members.name: draftContentAction
members.doc: Action to do regarding draft content

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to hide

members.name: commentId
members.doc: Id of the Comment to publish

messages.name: _wix_comments_ng_v1_ListCommentsByResourceRequest
messages.displayName: List Comments By Resource Request Object

members.name: contextType
members.doc: Context Type. Reserved for internal use.

members.name: commentSort
members.doc: Comment sorting. Is ignored if cursorPaging.cursor is defined

members.name: replySort

messages.name: _wix_comments_ng_v1_ListCommentsByResourceResponse
messages.displayName: List Comments By Resource Response Object

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: keepMarkedInOriginalOrder
members.doc:
If set to `true`, marked comments are included in the comments list but maintain their original order rather
 than being moved to the top.
 Defaults to `false`, which means marked comments, will be prioritized and listed first.

members.name: keepMarkedInOriginalOrder
members.doc:
If set to `true`, marked replies are included in the comments list but maintain their original order rather
 than being moved to the top.
 Defaults to `false`, which means marked replies, will be prioritized and listed first.

docs.summary:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the `Value` type union. The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`. Possible values are:
  • NULL_VALUE - Null value.

Possible values are:
  • AUTO - browser default, eqivalent to `initial`
  • LEFT - Left align
  • RIGHT - Right align
  • CENTER - Center align
  • JUSTIFY - Text is spaced to line up its left and right edges to the left and right edges of the line box, except for the last line

Possible values are:
  • SELF - Opens the linked document in the same frame as it was clicked (this is default)
  • BLANK - Opens the linked document in a new window or tab
  • PARENT - Opens the linked document in the parent frame
  • TOP - Opens the linked document in the full body of the window

Possible values are:
  • CONTENT - Width matches the content width
  • SMALL - Small Width
  • ORIGINAL - Width will match the original asset width
  • FULL_WIDTH - coast-to-coast display

Possible values are:
  • CENTER - Center Alignment
  • LEFT - Left Alignment
  • RIGHT - Right Alignment

Possible values are:
  • LINK - Regular link button
  • ACTION - Triggers custom action that is defined in plugin configuration by the consumer

Possible values are:
  • SINGLE - Single Line
  • DOUBLE - Double Line
  • DASHED - Dashed Line
  • DOTTED - Dotted Line

Possible values are:
  • LARGE - Large line
  • MEDIUM - Medium line
  • SMALL - Small line

Possible values are:
